TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005920_EMETSELCH<tab>You know as well as I that the emperor stands to lose this war. And so I have come to claim you.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005930_EMETSELCH<tab>For while your methods leave something to be desired, we cannot deny the results of your work.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005940_EMETSELCH<tab>And as fortune would have it, the seat of Fandaniel─your rightful seat─lies vacant and waiting. Take your place amongst your peers, rather than die a pointless death amidst the ashes of your doomed nation.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005950_EMETSELCH<tab>Send one of your clones to the Crystal Tower that you might see for yourself.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005960_EMETSELCH<tab>See what lies ahead...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005970_AMON<tab>The fall of the empire affirmed the truth. Majestic and tragic...as the emperor foresaw.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005980_AMON<tab>Scheme as you like, build as you will. Nothing endures.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_005990_AMON<tab>What is life, but a brief jaunt ending in emptiness?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006000_FANDANIEL<tab>(-Fandaniel-)So easily distracted! Why, I almost left without saying farewell.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006010_FANDANIEL<tab>(-Fandaniel-)As for your friend, you needn't worry─these pawns are far more useful to me alive as fuel for the primals.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006020_FANDANIEL<tab>(-Fandaniel-)Ah ah ah! If you attempt to pull them free, they <var 1A 02 /var>will<var 1A 01 /var> die, so─enjoy tackling that conundrum with your comrades!

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006030_FANDANIEL<tab>(-Fandaniel-)We shall meet again! Not in one of these minor spires, oh no, but somewhere more suitably grandiose. Your favorite playmate is ever so eager to see you.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006040_EMETSELCH<tab>A vast rock squats upon Thavnair, and to its stony surface clings the city of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006050_EMETSELCH<tab>Ye who enter here are subject to the scrutiny of gods─the gate's most watchful eye.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006060_EMETSELCH<tab>The orb which beholdeth the truth of all things.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006070_EMETSELCH<tab>Pass beneath its hot and piercing gaze, bearing down like a second midday sun.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006080_EMETSELCH<tab>The fragrant haze a mixture of sweet incense and acrid smoke. The cries of merchants mingled here with lively melodies accented by dancers' feet.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006090_EMETSELCH<tab>Travelers seduced by vivid sound and colors were once swallowed up by patchwork streets.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006100_EMETSELCH<tab>But no such scenes to savor now. To what somber present does that divine eye bear witness?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006110_VARSHAHN<tab>Here we are: Meghaduta.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006120_VARSHAHN<tab>It seems a shame to bring you here directly. Under normal circumstances, it would have been my pleasure to show you the sights.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006130_THANCRED<tab>And it would have been our pleasure to see them. Alas, it seems our tour of the city will have to wait.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006140_VARSHAHN<tab>I am afraid so. Come, we should head inside.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006150_VARSHAHN<tab>Your Excellency, may I present our honored visitors.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006160_AWAHEEN<tab>(-His Excellency-)Ah, splendid, most splendid!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006170_AWAHEEN<tab>Allow me to introduce myself. I am Ahewann, satrap of Radz-at-Han.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006180_AWAHEEN<tab>Our alchemists tell me your assistance was invaluable in the creation of the warding scale.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006190_AWAHEEN<tab>Such deeds ought to be recognized in person, thus did I have young Varshahn convey you here forthwith. On behalf of my people, may I express to you our sincere gratitude.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_Q8_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A8_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>But Nidhana, she was taken...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A8_000_002_NONE_VOICE<tab>Not everything went to plan.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006200_AWAHEEN<tab>A regrettable incident, indeed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006210_AWAHEEN<tab>I assume you speak of Nidhana? A regrettable incident, indeed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006220_AWAHEEN<tab>Her colleagues insist that we honor her wishes, and trust in the talisman─that it will be instrumental in saving Nidhana and the others.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006230_AWAHEEN<tab>I am eager to hear your opinion on the matter, so let us not stand on ceremony. Come, sit.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006240_ESTINIEN<tab>I think not.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006250_ESTINIEN<tab>This charade has gone on long enough. Show yourself.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006260_AWAHEEN<tab>Forgive me, but were you expecting musicians perhaps? There are no performers waiting in the wings at present, but arrangements could be made if you'd prefer─
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006270_VRITRA<tab>(-???-)Nay, he hath the right of it─the time for artifice is past. Raise the curtain.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006280_AWAHEEN<tab>As you wish.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006290_VRITRA<tab>(-???-)You travel as assistants to the Students of Baldesion, but you are known to me.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006300_VRITRA<tab>(-???-)Even here have we heard of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006310_VRITRA<tab>I am Vrtra, and for years uncounted hath this isle served as mine abode.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006320_URIANGER<tab>Vrtra! Of the first brood, sibling to Hraesvelgr and Nidhogg!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006330_VRITRA<tab>Aye, mine elder brothers. Of Midgardsormr's spawn, I was last to hatch.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006340_THANCRED<tab>Well, isn't this a surprise! We were told Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han had an alliance with a dragon, not that a great wyrm sat in the satrap's own hall...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006350_AWAHEEN<tab>A necessary subterfuge, as the true tale of our nation's history illustrates most effectively.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006360_AWAHEEN<tab>In the beginning, the rock upon which our city is built was home to Vrtra, and Vrtra alone.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006370_AWAHEEN<tab>In time, the ancestors of the Matanga came to the island and established a foothold, but never did they dare disturb the wyrm's lair.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006380_AWAHEEN<tab>Next to arrive were the Au Ra. Adopting the example of their Arkasodara allies, they too treated Vrtra with reverence and respect.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006390_AWAHEEN<tab>And for many years, an understanding between our forefathers and the great wyrm endured...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006400_AWAHEEN<tab>...Until marauding Hyurs from the mainland came, threatening to shatter our peace and tranquility.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006410_AWAHEEN<tab>When it seemed all would be drowned in blood, Vrtra himself came forth and quelled the rising conflict.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006420_AWAHEEN<tab>A peaceful accord was reached, and oaths sworn in Vrtra's name. Thus began the dragon's governance of the fledgling state which was to grow into Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006430_THANCRED<tab>But... If Vrtra is still here, then your position as satrap is just...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006440_AWAHEEN<tab>...A “charade”? Yes, and one which my family has performed faithfully for generations.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006450_VRITRA<tab>Many envy the great wyrms their power. Were it known that I ruled here, then the fires of war would burn without end.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006460_VRITRA<tab>I would not be the flame which consumeth my people. Those few who joined me in laying our country's foundations were, perforce, sworn to secrecy.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006470_ESTINIEN<tab>Your eye. It was taken?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006480_VARSHAHN<tab>'Tis here. Buried within this semblance of flesh.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006490_VARSHAHN<tab>The body before thee is but a simulacrum, constructed by the finest artisans of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han. With mine eye nestled within, it doth serve as an inconspicuous vessel for my will.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006500_ESTINIEN<tab>Ah. That would explain why I felt the presence of a dragon upon our first meeting.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006510_VARSHAHN<tab>I am woven with wards fashioned to deceive such arcane senses.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006520_VARSHAHN<tab>Though 'twas short-lived, it seemeth thy fusion with my brother hath left thee much altered, Estinien Wyrmblood.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006530_VARSHAHN<tab>From the very first, we sensed the nature of one another. Yet did neither one of us bare his fangs.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006540_VARSHAHN<tab>That is all I need know of thee for now.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006550_VRITRA<tab>With my secret thus revealed, I have for you a proposal. Not as a wyrm of the first brood, but as the ruler of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006560_VRITRA<tab>With all haste must we take in hand the finished talismans and breach this foul spire. Thence, should it lay within our power, dispel its wicked influence.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006570_VRITRA<tab>Yet even with the assurance of the warding scales, the narrow confines of the tower doth limit the size of our force.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006580_URIANGER<tab>And thus denied strength in numbers, thou must choose thy soldiers with care.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006590_VRITRA<tab>Just so. Yet though our Radiant Host is formidable, I see a surer path before me.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006600_VRITRA<tab>Thou and thy comrades have contended with a multitude of primal beings. Most recently thou didst cast down false gods in Paglth'an and Carteneau, I am told.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006610_VRITRA<tab>'Tis upon that strength I would call. The Scions have proven themselves most capable, and I ask that you serve as the tip of our spear.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006620_VRITRA<tab>Talismans would, of course, be provided for each of thy companions.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006630_VRITRA<tab>And should you agree to this undertaking, more will be provided to make use of as you see fit.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006640_THANCRED<tab>There's no denying it's a dangerous proposition, but the rewards may far outweigh the risk. Just think of what we might accomplish if we could equip all our allies with warding scales.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006650_THANCRED<tab>I worry, however, that even the four of us may be too few for what you have in mind. Might we regroup with our friends first to discuss the matter?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006660_VRITRA<tab>'Tis no trifling task that I have laid before you. Go, steel your hearts and hone your plans─such time as you require shall we spend in crafting your protective charms.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006670_THANCRED<tab>It seems a quick trip back to Sharlayan is in order...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006680_VRITRA<tab>Wilt thou not lend thine aid?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006690_ESTINIEN<tab>Whether your request be made as a great wyrm or the ruler of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han, I see no reason to refuse. Nor will I.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006700_VRITRA<tab>I am in thy debt.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006710_KRILE<tab>Your time in Thavnair has certainly been eventful.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006720_KRILE<tab>In my opinion, carrying out Vrtra's request and assaulting the Tower of Zot should be our highest priority.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006730_YSHTOLA<tab>I agree. While I still have questions concerning the Forum and their grand undertaking, we have all but exhausted our avenues of investigation.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006740_YSHTOLA<tab>Simply pressing them any harder on the subject will almost certainly result in our expulsion. Therefore I suggest we explore the aetherial sea connection by way of a letter to Master Matoya, then make our way to Thavnair.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006750_ALPHINAUD<tab>I wonder... Even with the protection these talismans afford us, what can we hope to achieve once inside the tower?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006760_ALPHINAUD<tab>According to Arenvald and Fordola's report, they were unable to free the Amalj'aa. Worse, their attempts triggered the tower's defenses, which led to a summoning of Lunar Ifrit.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006770_YSHTOLA<tab>What does it tell us that the spires even have such defenses?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006780_YSHTOLA<tab>Simply pulling a prisoner from the wall is fatal, thus the direct approach is doomed to failure from the outset. Any further measures to dissuade such actions seem...unnecessary.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006790_YSHTOLA<tab>Unless, of course, there <var 1A 02 /var>is<var 1A 01 /var> a way to free the prisoners without killing them. Then it stands to reason that any intruders would be met with overwhelming force.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006800_URIANGER<tab>The towers appeared throughout the world in but the twinkling of an eye. 'Twas by magical means these structures were raised, I surmise.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006810_URIANGER<tab>A spire thus conjured must needs be maintained, and I suspect an arcane catalyst─some manner of “core”─doth lie hidden within.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006820_URIANGER<tab>Destroy the core, and the tower ceaseth to be...thus liberating the captives without harm!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006830_YSHTOLA<tab>So we can hope. And I would prefer to enter the tower with a working theory than with no plan at all.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006840_THANCRED<tab>Assuming Y'shtola's reasoning is correct, the chances of the defenses remaining dormant are small to none.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006850_THANCRED<tab>Any primals will have to be dealt with, and defeating one will likely only lead to the summoning of another. Our every victory will only compound the prisoners' suffering.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006860_GRAHATIA<tab>May we not then divide our forces?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006870_GRAHATIA<tab>Those proficient in healing will focus on sustaining the captives. That duty can be covered by Urianger, Krile, Y'shtola, and myself.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006880_GRAHATIA<tab>The remaining Scions will proceed with the search for the core. Admittedly, this strategy puts both parties at greater risk, but it should bolster our chances of saving the Arkasodara by a considerable margin.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_Q9_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A9_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>Are you sure Alphinaud is in the right group?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A9_000_002_NONE_VOICE<tab>What of Alisaie? She knows a healing spell or two.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A9_000_003_NONE_VOICE<tab>Aren't you forgetting someone!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006890_GRAHATIA<tab>If you're to fight primals, then you'd best have at least one healer with you.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006900_ALPHINAUD<tab>And I am more than happy to fulfill that role. I've found wielding a sage's armaments to be rather intuitive, and look forward to testing them against a more challenging foe.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006910_GRAHATIA<tab>That she does, but I think Alisaie herself would assert that she's at her best when she's charging unto the breach.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006920_GRAHATIA<tab>And from what I recall from the Grand Cosmos, there's a spring in her step when she fights by your side.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006930_ALISAIE<tab>Ye gods, will you never let me hear the end of that? Rest assured that I will do what is asked of me regardless of who I happen to be standing next to at any given time!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006940_GRAHATIA<tab>Of course not! As our most talented healer, we need you leading the van, fighting primals on the front lines.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006950_KRILE<tab>It seems we have a plan; all that remains is to carry it out. I will inform Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han of our movements, so let us make our preparations and regroup near the tower.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006960_THANCRED<tab>The military post in what's left of the Hamsa Hatchery should serve as a convenient staging point.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006970_KRILE<tab>That sounds perfect! And remember: the experimental aetheryte at the Confluence is there for those who need it, so there's no excuse for being late!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006980_KRILE<tab>Is everyone all right!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_006990_GRAHATIA<tab>We fortified the captives with what magicks we could. Have the defenses been disabled? All appears quiet for the moment...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007000_KRILE<tab>The lower floors were disturbing enough, but this place feels...wrong. The aether is heavy and thick. Like wading through a quagmire...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007010_URIANGER<tab>I believe we stand in the tower's beating heart. What sayest thou, Y'shtola...?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007020_YSHTOLA<tab>I see it. Aether siphoned from the land runs up through the spire, flowing to a single point...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007030_YSHTOLA<tab>This is the core we seek.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007040_YSHTOLA<tab>Yet something is...off. As large as this structure is, it siphons far more aether than is required to sustain it.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007050_YSHTOLA<tab>'Tis as if the core is feeding on the energy. Consuming it. I need to take a closer look...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007060_YSHTOLA<tab>...Curious. There is something there, embedded inside the core.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007070_YSHTOLA<tab>A man's limb...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007080_ESTINIEN<tab>This is what we came to destroy?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007090_YSHTOLA<tab>Yes. If you would be so kind?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007100_ESTINIEN<tab>No subtitles. Report if displayed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007110_ALPHINAUD<tab>And that should be the end of it!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007120_ALISAIE<tab>Ugh, what now!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007130_URIANGER<tab>My theory that the tower might come crashing down following the core's destruction doth appear to be correct.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007140_ALISAIE<tab>Bully for you! And how are we supposed to survive the fall!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007150_GRAHATIA<tab>What of the prisoners below...!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007160_YSHTOLA<tab>The floor beneath our very feet dissolves. Brace yourselves!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007170_GRAHATIA<tab>I pray I'm not too late!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007180_ALISAIE<tab>What happened? Where are we?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007190_ALPHINAUD<tab>By my reckoning, we're still on the island where the tower stood but...'tis as if it never existed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007200_ALPHINAUD<tab>Hardly a scratch. But how...?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007210_KRILE<tab>G'raha wove a levitation spell at the last moment. Large enough to catch everyone, it would seem.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007220_THANCRED<tab>That explains the lack of obvious injuries.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007230_KRILE<tab>The expenditure of so much aether has taken its toll. He will need plenty of rest, but should otherwise be none the worse for wear.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007240_THANCRED<tab>Then the immediate problem is what to do with our new friends here.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007250_THANCRED<tab>They'll be much changed for their time in the tower. Even if their bodies are intact, I doubt we could say the same for their minds.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007260_ALISAIE<tab>Angelo and I will take care of that.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007270_THANCRED<tab>I have every faith in you, Alisaie, but there are just too many for you to treat alone.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007280_YSHTOLA<tab>We'll send at once to Eorzea for more porxies, and call on the local mages to lend a hand.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007290_VARSHAHN<tab>Hail, Scions!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007300_VARSHAHN<tab>We were watching the tower, when it simply...disappeared. What happened here?

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007310_URIANGER<tab>The threat is banished, and thy people delivered. They are, however, in need of treatment, and we of a secure locale and helping hands to assist us in its provision.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007320_VARSHAHN<tab>You shall have all this and more. Come, let us convey these unfortunate souls to the city.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007330_THANCRED<tab>...Are we the last to arrive? I hope we've not kept you waiting!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007340_AWAHEEN<tab>Not at all. Your comrade is feeling better, I trust?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007350_GRAHATIA<tab>Much better, thank you. Hannish remedies are certainly potent─in more ways than one.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007360_AWAHEEN<tab>One becomes accustomed to the taste, although I hope you never have cause to do so. Pray take your ease.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007370_GRAHATIA<tab>Full glad I am to see you all unharmed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007380_VRITRA<tab>Valiant Scions. For your heroism, you have my boundless gratitude.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007390_VRITRA<tab>You cast down that dire tower and set free its hapless captives. You cleansed their souls of its corrupting influence.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007400_VRITRA<tab>No words of thanks will suffice. In place of platitudes, I offer a bounty of warding scales.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007410_VRITRA<tab>Pray accept your due reward, along with the goodwill of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007420_AWAHEEN<tab>Alchemists throughout the land were put to work in the forging of your talismans. The finished ones have been collected, and now await you at the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007430_AWAHEEN<tab>Present this letter when you are ready to take them into your possession.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007440_ALPHINAUD<tab>We are humbled by your generosity. Know that the inventive wisdom of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han will be vital in restoring serenity to our star.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007450_ALISAIE<tab>Every single one of those scales came from you, didn't they? You must still be in such pain...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007460_VRITRA<tab>'Tis of no moment. A mere annoyance compared to the dreadful suffering inflicted upon this land and its people.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007470_ALPHINAUD<tab>Albeit brief, my involvement in the Dragonsong War afforded me a glimpse of the myriad sorrows which consumed both dragon and man.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007480_ALPHINAUD<tab>Though you were half a world away, such tragedies as befell your kin must have affected you deeply.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007490_ALPHINAUD<tab>And yet you chose to live among men.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007500_VRITRA<tab>In the age when that conflict first bloomed, my choice had already been made.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007510_VRITRA<tab>In some distant place, man slew dragon, and dragon slaughtered man. Yet no hate could I muster for those smiling faces which did look to me for guidance.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007520_VRITRA<tab>Not even my brother's righteous rage could rally me to his cause. I huddled here, secret and still, hoping against hope that which I had built would remain untouched by the chaos and carnage.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007530_YSHTOLA<tab>'Twould seem we share the same desire for peace, great Vrtra. To that end, I wonder if we might trouble you with another question.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007540_YSHTOLA<tab>The Telophoroi are intent on recreating the Final Days, an apocalyptic event which we know to predate the sundering of the star.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007550_YSHTOLA<tab>As the longest lived among us, know you aught of this terrible cataclysm?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007560_VRITRA<tab>Nay. When war and strife drove my sire from his home, he crossed the great expanse with only our unhatched eggs as company.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007570_VRITRA<tab>He alighted upon a shattered Source, its thirteen reflections long since scattered beyond the rift.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007580_VRITRA<tab>Of events preceding his arrival, he knoweth naught save that which Hydaelyn hath deigned to disclose.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007590_YSHTOLA<tab>I see... So again, 'tis the inscrutable Hydaelyn to whom we must look for answers.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007600_VRITRA<tab>Seek you to divine the will of this star? If so, I have a tale which may afford you some small comfort.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007610_VRITRA<tab>'Tis a story from my youth, many, many years ago... To my sire, I once posed the question, “Of all the stars in the sky, why didst thou settle upon this one?”
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007620_VRITRA<tab>To which Midgardsormr did reply, “'Twas the last bastion of hope.”
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007630_VRITRA<tab>He believed, so long as Hydaelyn endured, so too might dragonkind.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007640_VRITRA<tab>Solemn and portentous were his words. What deeper meaning they held, I could not─dared not─pursue. 'Tis a stone I've left unturned ever since.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007650_VRITRA<tab>Yet take you solace in the knowledge that, whatsoever Hydaelyn doth strive towards, 'tis an ideal which hath earned my sire's conviction.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007660_YSHTOLA<tab>Thank you, Vrtra. You've given us warm reassurance in a world gripped by cold uncertainty.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007670_THANCRED<tab>While I'm sure we all have a great many questions, I think it's time we collect the talismans and be on our way. Our fight against the Telophoroi is far from finished.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007680_KRILE<tab>We must take our leave, but please do inform us if we can provide any further assistance.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007690_VRITRA<tab>Prithee, a moment.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007700_VRITRA<tab>There is one whom my sire hath judged worthy of honor and respect─the one known to men as Eorzea's champion. This hero of renown and rumor...'tis thee.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_Q10_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A10_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>Midgardsormr and I have crossed paths, yes.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A10_000_002_NONE_VOICE<tab>I've not spoken with your father in some time...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A10_000_003_NONE_VOICE<tab>I only wish he could be here with us now...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007710_VRITRA<tab>I knew it to be so. From man and dragon alike have I learned of thine exploits.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007720_VRITRA<tab>In accordance with the covenant he forged with Hydaelyn, the stewardship of this star hath ever been his purpose. Silence in the face of thine actions is the greatest sign of his approval.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007730_VRITRA<tab>I know of his clash with Omega, and the long slumber which was his price.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007740_VRITRA<tab>Yet even closed in sleep, my father's eyes are far from blind. He is watching over thee; watching over this world.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007750_VRITRA<tab>'Twas a revelation most pleasing that thou─a child of man─had gained Midgardsormr's trust. But alongside mine elation runneth a rivulet of dread.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007760_VRITRA<tab>For upon thy life's reel wind too many threads. Of fate. Power. Weal, enmeshed with woe.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007770_VRITRA<tab>Amidst this tangled knot, thou shalt know no rest. 'Tis an endless confluence of forces; a struggle without surcease.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007780_VRITRA<tab>More terrible still is the attrition wrought upon thy companions, as they are swept up in the storm of thine existence.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007790_VRITRA<tab>Take heart and protect them well. They will be your strength and your salvation. The hope thou wilt need come the end.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007800_VRITRA<tab>Even cowering behind my curtain, I know the suffering of the powerful. I have watched my siblings driven mad by loss.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007810_VRITRA<tab>Thus do I exhort thee to spare no effort to keep thy loved ones safe.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007820_ALPHINAUD<tab>Ah, apologies. We hadn't meant to interrupt.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007830_ALISAIE<tab>It's just that we <var 1A 02 /var>do<var 1A 01 /var> have a history of suddenly collapsing, and when you didn't follow us out...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007840_VRITRA<tab>'Tis I who must apologize. I have detained your champion overlong with idle chatter.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007850_VRITRA<tab>Go. At war's end, I pray I welcome thee back into my hall, where together with thy joyful comrades you may toast your triumph.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007860_ALISAIE<tab>These are the talismans we were promised?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007870_YSHTOLA<tab>Yes, and I made a quick count: there are far more than we could have hoped for.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007880_YSHTOLA<tab>Enough to outfit an entire company of soldiers, in fact. Considering the involved process, that they were able to manufacture so many in such a short span of time is nothing short of a miracle.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007890_ALPHINAUD<tab>Once we have distributed them to our allies in Eorzea and the Far East, we'll have a fighting chance to bring down the other spires─just as we did with the Tower of Zot.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007900_YSHTOLA<tab>Or, we could use them to invade Garlemald proper, and strike directly at the Telophoroi's base of operations...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007910_YSHTOLA<tab>Of course, we would need to consult with various Alliance leaders before such a drastic measure could even be contemplated.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007920_YSHTOLA<tab>To which end I could set out forthwith and present the idea to each of our allies in person.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007930_URIANGER<tab>Pray allow me to undertake some few of those journeys. I find myself restless, and in need of purposeful duties.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007940_THANCRED<tab>I can head eastward. Bozja and Dalmasca are just a short hop from here, and Doma's shinobi network should come in handy for passing on the word.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007950_YSHTOLA<tab>We shall share the burden, then.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007960_YSHTOLA<tab>Meanwhile, I think it best that you and the others take the talismans back to the Baldesion Annex. We must keep them safe and secure until we've decided upon a course of action.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007970_NIDHANA<tab>Please, I must speak with you!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007980_THANCRED<tab>Nidhana!? You're awake!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_007990_NIDHANA<tab>Yes. When I spoke with the carer at my bedside, she told me that one of the Scions─a young woman─had cleansed me of the tower's corruption.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008000_NIDHANA<tab>It seems I've been asleep ever since the treatment... But when I awoke and learned you were all still here, I knew I had to come.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008010_ALISAIE<tab>As you said, Nidhana was captured only recently.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008020_ALISAIE<tab>Such a brief exposure is swiftly cured, so I tended to her before we gathered at Meghaduta.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008030_NIDHANA<tab>And I am truly grateful that you did! I cannot thank you enough...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008040_NIDHANA<tab>All of you─for everything you've done. Destroying the tower, rescuing our people...you've saved Thavnair from an awful fate!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008050_URIANGER<tab>Yet who hath truly saved whom?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008060_URIANGER<tab>Due in no small part to thine inspirational courage, the alchemists were successful in reproducing warding scales of proven efficacy.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008070_URIANGER<tab>Replications of thy work now stand ready to travel across the seas, unto the hands of those who might wield them against this rising evil.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008080_NIDHANA<tab>The talisman? Is this true!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008090_NIDHANA<tab>I was so groggy from sleep, I didn't even think to ask.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008100_NIDHANA<tab>Our great work, sent across the seas...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008110_NIDHANA<tab>It was worth it. It was all worth it!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008120_KRILE<tab>Look at that! Its color is completely changed!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008130_NIDHANA<tab>What do you have there...?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008140_NIDHANA<tab>How unusual. I wonder if the effect is a reaction to akasa.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008150_KRILE<tab>I'm afraid I'm not familiar with that term.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008160_NIDHANA<tab>Akasa? It is one of the unseen energies defined by Hannish alchemical theory.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008170_NIDHANA<tab>Though a gross oversimplification, some describe it as an essence influenced by feelings.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008180_ALPHINAUD<tab>You imply that it is distinct from aether?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008190_NIDHANA<tab>Foreign scholars often conflate the two, but we see them as separate concepts.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008200_NIDHANA<tab>Aether is an energy which permeates the land. It exists within animals, objects, even the air we breathe, affecting all through which it flows.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008210_NIDHANA<tab>Akasa, on the other hand, exists in a domain beyond our reach. A gift bestowed from on high─or torn from the heavens, in some traditions.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008220_NIDHANA<tab>Akasa can neither be created, nor destroyed. It is beyond our power to purposefully alter or manipulate.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008230_NIDHANA<tab>The only thing observed to influence it is an abundance of...I want to say “spiritual emotion.”
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008240_NIDHANA<tab>As a veteran of the battlefield, surely you've experienced moments of desperation or exaltation when you've transcended the usual limits of your capabilities?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008250_NIDHANA<tab>That is a manifestation of akasa, the invisible essence harnessed by heart, mind, and unyielding spirit!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008260_YSHTOLA<tab>I really must hear more about this theory! Our disciplines are based entirely upon the idea that aether is the fundamental form of all energy.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008270_NIDHANA<tab>I'm glad my haphazard explanation has piqued your interest.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008280_NIDHANA<tab>But even for us, akasa is a somewhat abstract field of study. A lack of practical application lends itself poorly to formalized research.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008290_NIDHANA<tab>Which is why my analysis of your flower can amount to little more than idle speculation. I am sorry...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008300_KRILE<tab>Nonsense, you have nothing to be sorry for. Your insight is much appreciated!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008310_ALPHINAUD<tab>Shall we depart for Sharlayan, then? I will see to it that the talismans arrive at the annex.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008320_THANCRED<tab>And we will be in touch once our talks are concluded. I suggest you rest while you can─from here onward, sleep is bound to be in short supply.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008330_VRITRA<tab>Take heart and protect them well.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008340_ALISAIE<tab>Good, you're here! You haven't eaten yet, have you?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008350_ALISAIE<tab>We've brought quite a spread if you're interested. Only the finest dining from the Last Stand!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008355_GRAHATIA<tab>No subtitles. Report if displayed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008356_GRAHATIA<tab>No subtitles. Report if displayed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008357_ALISAIE<tab>No subtitles. Report if displayed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008358_GRAHATIA<tab>No subtitles. Report if displayed.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008360_ALPHINAUD<tab>Lest you wonder, we invited Estinien as well.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008370_ALPHINAUD<tab>But he refused with a rather grim-faced “No, thank you.” I suspect Sharlayan cuisine is not to his liking...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008380_KRILE<tab>Oh, I don't know about that. Perhaps our lone wolf just needed some time apart.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008390_ALISAIE<tab>What, to perfect his brooding stare!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008400_ALISAIE<tab>Next time, I'll drag him out by the ear, sit him down in front of a Sharlayan feast, and see that he eats every last bite.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008410_ALPHINAUD<tab>An excellent idea. Of all people, warriors must take proper meals and rest if they are to maintain a healthy constitution.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008420_KRILE<tab>Poor Estinien, beset on all sides.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008430_GRAHATIA<tab>Speaking of one's physical condition, Mistress Krile, I hear you recently played literal host to Hydaelyn Herself...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008440_KRILE<tab>And what an experience that was. Tiring, yes, but no lasting harm done.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008450_KRILE<tab>If anything, I should have liked to speak with Her longer... I've not felt a hint of Her presence since.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008460_ALISAIE<tab>Hydaelyn instructed you to carry that flower, yes?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008470_ALISAIE<tab>'Twill be your guide─“test and proof of your conviction.” And then something about seeking joy in darkness, was it?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008480_ALISAIE<tab>Come to think of it... Isn't that what happened with Nidhana, back in Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008490_ALPHINAUD<tab>The flower did seem to radiate a joyful glow. As if reflecting the elation we all felt. The relief of a people with renewed hope.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008500_GRAHATIA<tab>Indeed. And in turn, I felt buoyed by that radiance. 'Twas akin to spotting a beacon, and knowing we were on the right path.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008510_GRAHATIA<tab>I know we've not yet triumphed over the Telophoroi, or learned the full breadth of the Forum's plans...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008520_GRAHATIA<tab>But even within the midst of our struggles, we find small moments of joy to sustain us.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008530_GRAHATIA<tab>Rare and hard-won, perhaps. But it is this pursuit of happiness that gives us the strength to carry on, day after day...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008540_GRAHATIA<tab>Hey! That's mine!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008550_ALISAIE<tab>To the swift, the spoils! Though I recall that levitation spell of yours was quick enough.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008560_GRAHATIA<tab>Only barely. And even at my best, I'm still too slow to wield it effectively in battle.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008570_GRAHATIA<tab>Mayhap I simply require more practice with this new magick...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008580_ALPHINAUD<tab>You unearthed it from the depths of Noumenon, I presume?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008590_GRAHATIA<tab>Aye, and from a veritable mountain of arcane tomes, at that. 'Twas...necessary to facilitate my solitary explorations.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008600_ALISAIE<tab>Or, to put it simply, you used it to sneak around the forbidden archives.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008610_GRAHATIA<tab>Ah, yes, well...after a fashion...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008620_GRAHATIA<tab>They're tall, you see...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008630_GRAHATIA<tab>The shelves─they're too tall for me! And I could hardly move the library's platforms without attracting attention now, could I!?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008640_ALPHINAUD<tab>Ohhh...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008650_ALISAIE<tab>Ohhh...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008660_KRILE<tab>Ohhh...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_Q11_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A11_000_001_NONE_VOICE<tab>Are we pushing on until dawn?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A11_000_002_NONE_VOICE<tab>Shall we call it a night?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_A11_000_003_NONE_VOICE<tab>You do know these are “my” quarters...?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008670_ALPHINAUD<tab>I'm not that ambitious. But 'tis pleasant to idle away the hours every once in a while.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008680_ALISAIE<tab>One last cup of tea, then. Dickon said this brew helps relax the mind before bed...and gave us some leaves for free!
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008690_KRILE<tab>Why else did you think we were here? Surrender to thy fate, O champion!

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008700_AMON<tab>Ah, enjoying the bracing cold, I see. Do you not own a warm coat or a cloak? Something in fur or fashioned from the skins of your enemies, or...? Well, never mind that.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008710_AMON<tab>I come to you once more as the bearer of bad news.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008720_AMON<tab>Our tower in Thavnair has been toppled, and I need not tell you by whom.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008730_AMON<tab>Given how many we have at our disposal, the loss of a single spire is hardly fatal to our plans. It does, however, slow the rate at which we siphon aether.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008740_AMON<tab>If they continue to preoccupy themselves with the towers, then all will be well. But should our foe prove bold enough to strike at us here, then the timing becomes...questionable.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008750_ZENOS<tab>Our foe is bold enough. Of that, I can assure you.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008760_AMON<tab>Yes, very well, then... I suppose I must prepare a proper welcome.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008770_AMON<tab>Honestly, talk of your nemesis is the only thing you seem to enjoy. Does nothing else spark your interest?
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008780_ZENOS<tab>Hmm... No. All else is...equal.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008790_ZENOS<tab>Equally tedious. Equally disappointing. The world is a tepid bog into which we sink, too weak to thrash as the mud clings to our eyes and fills our throats till we blissfully choke.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008800_ZENOS<tab>But then came the light. Blinding and pure and hot─so very hot. Enough to set my soul aflame.

TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008810_ZENOS<tab>I basked in the afterglow...until the void yawned once more. And then I knew the muck would never claim me again. There was naught for me ahead, so I drew the curtain on all that had come before.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008820_ZENOS<tab>Burn, burn. Let the whole star burn. I will have my contest. I will reclaim my moment.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008830_AMON<tab>How wonderful that the emptiness of death has not dissuaded you from committing your life to its pursuit once more.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008840_AMON<tab>I don't know whether to envy you or pity you...
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008850_ZENOS<tab>You question my disinterest, but what of yours? Despite your noisome antics, I sense you take little pleasure in this endeavor.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008860_AMON<tab>Mercy, my lord... Such pointed barbs from one who barely acknowledges my existence.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008870_AMON<tab>Nevertheless, you are mistaken, for I do find this part somewhat enjoyable.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008880_AMON<tab>You see, when I was mortal, I would always have the same dream.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008890_AMON<tab>It was a fragmented thing. Disjointed. All the faces incomplete. The setting, too, was unknown to me, so I thought it simply a fantasy of my sleeping mind.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008900_AMON<tab>Until one day, I realized it was showing me the truth─much as your dream of the Final Days enlightened you.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008910_AMON<tab>And soon, very soon, the rest of the world will see the truth of my dream too.
TEXT_VOICEMAN_06000_008920_AMON<tab>Yes, I think that is something we can both enjoy.
